column4: Hello everyone. I am writing a script (not on ubuntu machine). Any ideas how can I get the current release's codename and numeric version? (I guess from a webpage or mirrors?)
I do NOT want to get my distro's version. I want to get what is exact release now, at this moment
like I said, read the man page
it will work on ANY standard Linux
i'd ask in a solaris room then
why ask in an Linux channel about Solaris...?
instead of looking at the make etc, look at the components on the board to check compatibility
wrong target on that last one, sorry
what is the output of: wget -O alsa-info.sh http://alsa-project.org/alsa-info.sh && bash ./alsa-info.sh
actually I have three identical PCs, two with Maverick and one with Debian/Squeeze. All have same problem... :(
can you run the script on the ubuntu systems and give the link generated please
